DOC.brief_title: Influences of Phenylephrine, Dopamine and Ephedrine on Stroke Volume Variation and Pulse Pressure Variation
DOC.detailed_description: Pulse pressure variation (PPV) and stroke volume variation (SVV) during mechanical ventilation have been shown to be effective parameters to predict preload responsiveness. Although induced hypertension decreases PPV and SVV, the influences of phenylephrine, dopamine and ephedrine on PPV and SVV are unknown.
DOC.criteria: Their American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status was 1 or 2 Body mass index (BMI) ranged from 18 to 26 None of the patients had known diabetes mellitus, hypertension, cardiovascular, pulmonary, endocrinological, neurological diseases, or diseases that influenced intravascular fluid volume or balance All patients had a preoperative fast for at least 8 h and routine atropine intramuscular injection Persistent arrhythmias Intraoperative application of vasoactive drugs except phenylephrine, dopamine and ephedrine
